title: Alex Jones Show - 2011 Jun 05 SU [sebaygo1]
description:
.
							
The Alex Jones Show
Sunday, 05 June 2011


[sebaygo1]


The 2 hour Sunday show is typically a review of the past week's news and a look forward to the coming week's events.

The Infowars web site describes today's broadcast as follows.

On this edition of Alex's Sunday Show, Alex talks about the large turn-out at the Jefferson Memorial on Saturday in response to a law banning dancing at the monument and the brutal arrest by out of control Park Service cops of several activists at the site the previous week. 

Alex also talks with film-maker, broadcaster and former broker and options trader Max Keiser about the economy and other topics.

 It is my opinion that in this time it is virtually essential 
 to seek information from a variety of sources, to listen to a
 spectrum of voices in order to better  understand the "big 
 picture." A reliance solely upon mainstream corporate media 
 for news and info is a prescription for ignorance. I try to
 share information that counters the monotone of mainstream
 corporate media. 

 NOTE: The material here is made available strictly as
 information. Do not assume my support for or endorsement 
 of the contents.

 Think for yourself! To paraphrase the late William Cooper: 
 Read everything, listen to everything, but believe nothing 
 until you've researched it yourself.
